intro: Ceodes lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf ceodes, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ceodes lanceolata produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
